title: Dynamical R-Matrices for Integrable Maps
abstract: The integrability of two symplectic maps, that can be considered as discrete-time analogs of the Garnier and Neumann systems is established in the framework of the $r$-matrix approach, starting from their Lax representation. In contrast with the continuous case, the $r$-matrix for such discrete systems turns out to be of dynamical type; remarkably, the induced Poisson structure appears as a linear combination of compatible ``more elementary" Poisson structures. It is also shown that the Lax matrix naturally leads to define separation variables, whose discrete and continuous dynamics is investigated.
